intro: Linaria veronicoides, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Linaria veronicoides is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas due to its adaptability and hardy nature.
